name: Captain Parker
descriptions: Captain Parker is an NCR officer in charge of the Aerotech Office Park in Fallout: New Vegas.

As the head of the refugee camp, it is up to Captain Parker and Doctor Bert Gunnarsson to ensure that people down on their luck have somewhere to go to. Although he is seemingly perpetually short on people and supplies, he tries his best to make the park livable.

The uphill struggle makes him more than a little high-strung. Parker is particularly haunted by the memory of a blonde girl with a stuffed bear. She did not speak much, but he remembered her when she and her family suddenly disappeared.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Dammit, I didn't want you to kill him, just find me some evidence!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about those disappearances again.
topics.response_text: Some people have gone missing from the camp lately. Haven't seen any signs of violence or heard about any feuds, they just... up and left.

topics.topic_text: ParkerHelp
topics.response_text: Well... that was a bit messier than I would have liked. Was there anything else?

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: Captain Parker. I'm in charge of this camp.{Name's Parker. I'm in charge of keeping this camp operating smoothly.}

topics.topic_text: I've got evidence - Keith has a set of marked cards he uses to cheat.
topics.response_text: Marked cards, huh? I suppose it's obvious, really. Here, you've earned this.

topics.topic_text: What exactly is this place?
topics.response_text: This here's where folks go when their luck runs out. Drifters up from the Republic, locals that can't turn a dime, drunken reprobates from all around.

topics.topic_text: I found this ledger in Dermot's room.
topics.response_text: Let me see that... I know these names. Nephi and Cook-Cook are major players with the Fiends. Dermot and Saint James must be working with them.

topics.topic_text: I found this teddy bear in Saint James' room. Look familiar?
topics.response_text: That... I think that's her teddy bear! It's suspicious, but it doesn't tell us what happened to the refugees.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like a chaotic place. Is there any way I can help?
topics.response_text: Well, I am a little short staffed. Maybe you could give me a hand.

topics.topic_text: Charming place. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Yeah? Like what?

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the missing people?
topics.response_text: They never seemed to have much in common - that's why I didn't notice it sooner. Young folks, old folks, men, women... all disappearing.

topics.topic_text: I'm not really interested in running your errands, sorry.
topics.response_text: Well, you did ask if we needed help.

topics.topic_text: Can you remember anything else?
topics.response_text: Seem to recall a lot of them did business with those scavengers over on the West Side - Dermott and Saint James.

topics.topic_text: You just shot that man, solely because he insulted you!
topics.response_text: Yep. I always warned him not to push my buttons. Well, ain't nobody going to miss him, anyways.

topics.topic_text: That might have been a tad... excessive.
topics.response_text: Maybe, maybe not. I always warned him not to push my buttons. Well, ain't nobody going to miss him, anyways.

topics.topic_text: Just the matter of my extra pay.
topics.response_text: Here you go. I promised you an extra reward for coming along, so that's what you get.

topics.topic_text: I'll be back later.
topics.response_text: Keep at it. I need to find out what happened.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about this "Keith."
topics.response_text: Keith's a two-bit hustler, he runs a gambling operation out of his shack. Ask me, he wins way too often to be playing fair.

topics.topic_text: Sure, I'm in. Why not?
topics.response_text: Glad to have you. Let's go. Just stick close and follow my lead. Keith's a cowardly son of a bitch, but he might try something if he's desperate.

topics.topic_text: I'll leave this one to the law.
topics.response_text: Fair enough - you've done a lot already. I appreciate it.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll look into it.
topics.response_text: Glad to hear it.

topics.topic_text: That's too bad, but not my problem.
topics.response_text: Hey, you asked, I answered.

topics.topic_text: Saint James and Dermot were behind it. They're dead now.
topics.response_text: How do you know? Did you find proof?

topics.topic_text: I found this evidence in their rooms - they attacked when I confronted them.
topics.response_text: Those sick bastards - can't say I'll shed any tears for them. Here, you've earned this.

topics.topic_text: I'll keep looking.
topics.response_text: All right. Maybe Dermot's got something, as well.

topics.topic_text: I'll keep looking.
topics.response_text: All right. Maybe Saint James has something connected to the refugees as well.

topics.topic_text: Any ideas what to look for?
topics.response_text: We know there's a connection with the refugees, but we need to know where they could be found. There could be more evidence in Dermot's room.

topics.topic_text: Any ideas what to look for?
topics.response_text: We need a direct connection to the refugees, now that we've got an idea of what happened to them. Saint James could have something in his room.

topics.topic_text: I found all the evidence you'll need from Saint James' and Dermot's rooms. Here.
topics.response_text: Let's see... a bear. Yes, this belonged to the little girl, so that's a direct connection to the missing people.

conversation.response_text: Keith! In the name of the NCR, I'm placing you under arrest for illicit gambling and the sale of unlicensed chems.
